details.flying: These birds are able to fly very well
details.features: They have a sharp, hooked beak with visible nostrils
details.feeding: they eat the meat of other animals.

details.flying: have mighty wings that are adapted for the long â€“ distance flights
details.features: All of these birds have a prominent neck, from medium to long.The birds have varied coloring, from black, grey and brown to brighter coloring in some species, like mandarin ducks.
details.feeding: Most anseriformes feed on plants or their parts, such as leaves or seeds. Some of them can hunt for insects, plankton, or mollusks

details.flying: Hummingbirds rely on hovering flight and have powerful muscles
details.features: Most of the birds in this order are either small or very small
details.feeding: Hummingbirds depend on nectar as a food source. Their beaks are highly specialized for that purpose

details.features: Kiwis have a small, pear-shaped body. One of their prominent features is the presence of robust legs and feet.
details.feeding: they mainly feed on earthworms, beetles, and larvae, but sometimes can eat fruit and leaves.

details.flying: These birds are able to fly very well
details.features: The most prominent feature of the birds in this order is the presence of large, hard bills.
details.feeding: These birds feed predominantly on insects

details.flying: These birds are terrestrial birds that live on the ground, and seldom fly.
details.features: Caprimugiformes have large heads with large eyes and most of the birds in the order are relatively small
details.feeding: These birds mainly feed on insects

details.flying: These birds can fly in the dark
details.features: These birds are large with long legs adapted for running. They can grow as high as one meter and weigh about 1.5 kg.
details.feeding: These birds are omnivorous, can feed on snakes, small mammals, insects, and plants.
